Update an LRPS

Source: R/lrps-class.R, R/multi_ellipsoid.R, R/rwmh_cube.R, and 2 more
update_lrps.Rd

Update the behaviour of a likelihood-restricted prior sampler with interim information from a nested sampling run.

Usage

update_lrps(x, ...)

# S3 method for class 'multi_ellipsoid'
update_lrps(x, unit = NULL, log_volume = NA, ...)

# S3 method for class 'rwmh_cube'
update_lrps(x, unit = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for class 'slice_rectangle'
update_lrps(x, unit = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for class 'unif_ellipsoid'
update_lrps(x, unit = NULL, log_volume = NA, ...)

Arguments

x

[ernest_lrps]
A likelihood-restricted prior sampler.

...

Presently ignored.

unit

[matrix(double(), integer(), x$n_dim)]
The current live set stored within the run. Optional; if NULL no LRPS updates based on the state of the live set will be made.

log_volume

[double(1)]
The current log-volume of the nested sampling run.

Value

[ernest_lrps], created by reconstructing x with updated parameters.

Details

During a nested sampling run, you may wish to update the internal parameters of the LRPS based on sampler performance or other criterion. The frequency of these updates is set by the first_update and update_interval arguments of ernest_sampler().

If you are creating your own ernest_lrps subclass, implement this method to specify any special update behaviour. The default method reconstructs the LRPS with current parameters and resets the likelihood call counter in the cache.
